step1.sentence: She heard through a mutual friend that they had broken up after two years together.

step2.story: The school band that had performed together for three years announced it was breaking up after the final concert. Each member had decided to pursue different paths after graduation.

step3.story: When Ana and her partner broke up, she kept it to herself for a week before telling her closest friends. She was not sad in the way she expected to be. In fact, after a few days, she felt lighter and more like herself. She spent the following weekend rearranging her apartment and hanging new photos on the wall.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 연인 사이가 끝나다; 그룹이나 조직이 해체되다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 연인 관계가 끝날 때, 또는 그룹이나 팀이 해체될 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: break(깨다)와 up(완전히)이 결합하여 관계나 조직이 완전히 깨진다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 연인 사이 이별을 가장 자연스럽게 표현하는 단어입니다. split up과도 비슷한 뜻입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: They broke up quietly after realizing they wanted different things.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 서로가 다른 것을 원한다는 것을 깨닫고 조용히 헤어졌어요.
